string-array.name: conversation
string-array.item: Do you want to draw a picture together?
Sure! I only have a few crayons, though!
Great. Student find some markers crayons or colored pencils that I can use and take a picture of them.
Then find some others that I can use and take a picture of them.
Then take a picture of them all together and see how many we have in total!

resources.string:
This app demonstrates the principle of the naive Bayes classifier.
 If it is the first time you use this app, its database is empty and you should teach it some samples.
 1. Write a digit on the screen and touch the corresponding button to let the app learn a sample.
 2. After the app learns some samples, you can write a digit and touch "Recognize" to let the app tell you which digit you have written.
 3. Let the app learn more samples and you will see: The more samples it learns, the cleverer it will be.
Thank you!\nYou have taught me a sample and I have learned it.
Please tap on image to type text.
The probabilities of each digit are listed below:
Jose: Do you want to draw a picture together?
May: Sure! I only have a few crayons, though!
May: Great. Student, find some markers, crayons, or colored pencils that I can use and take a picture of them.
Jose. Then find some others that I can use and take a picture of them.
Then take a picture of them all together and see how many we have in total!
